VI. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
Maltreatment in Care
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this licensing
period.
Corrective Action Plan Compliance
The agency has not been required to submit any corrective action plans during this
period under review.
Financial Overview
There are no financial concerns based on the facility’s budget and financial audit.
PREA compliance (if applicable)
Not Applicable.
Chief Administrator Assessment
Chief Administrator Assessment was done on time and was comprehensive and
reviewed the areas of noncompliance from the previous licensing review. There
are no repeat citations from the interim inspection in 2022.
Staff and Youth Interviews
Two direct care staff and one supervisor were interviewed. Staff reported feeling
supported by supervisor, and upper management. They said the facility’s main
goal is ensuring the safety and well-being of the youths, and the administration
strives at ensuring all the youths needs are being met.
Three youths were interviewed. They reported all their needs are being met and
expressed no concerns regarding staff or the facility.
Description of Agency Walk Through
An on-site inspection and walkthrough of the agency occurred on 11/14/2023. the
agency was found to be clean, neat, and appropriate. Kitchen observed to have
menu posted, plenty of food, and very clean. No concerns noted.

VII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the agency is in compliance with all applicable licensing
statutes. It is recommended that the agency be issued a renewal of their regular
license.
